messages.content:
I'll help translate and explain this text which contains verses from the Quran and their interpretation. The text begins with "Guide us to the straight path" (Ø§Ù‡Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø§Ù„ØµØ±Ø· Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø³ØªÙ‚ÙŠÙ…) from Surah Al-Fatiha, and then provides an explanation about the straight path as detailed in Surah Al-An'am, verses 151-153.

Here's the translation:

"Guide us to the straight path"
These words from the Opening of the Book (Al-Fatiha) express our hope and plea to the Almighty to guide us to follow His straight path. He has explained His straight path to us in Surah Al-An'am, verses 151-153: "Say: Come, I will recite what your Lord has forbidden to you: Do not associate anything with Him, be good to your parents, do not kill your children out of poverty... Do not approach immoralities, whether public or private, and do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden except by right... Do not approach the orphan's property except in a way that is best... Give full measure and weight in justice, and when you speak, be just, even if it concerns a close relative, and fulfill Allah's covenant... And this is My straight path, so follow it and do not follow other paths, for they will separate you from His path. This is what He has instructed you that you may become righteous."

These are the Ten Commandments given to Moses (peace be upon him). Among these commandments, only one relates to worship of the Almighty - not associating partners with Him. The remaining nine prohibitions concern noble human relationships for the security and safety of the individual in their social life. From this, we can understand that the core of the final message revolves around humanity and its freedom.
